section.title: Description
section.p: This tool modifies a group. This tool is a centralized version of groupmod. It runs on OAME nodes and distributes the operation to all the specified nodes. The options applicable to groupmod are directly passed to it. For information on groupmod options, see groupmod manual.

row.entry: Continues to run the previously failed operation.
Forces to run the current operation regardless of previous failures.
Displays this help message and exits.
Specifies which host names (comma-separated) the operation is applied to. The internal IP addresses can also be used. Overrides -T.

entry.p: Specifies which node types (comma-separated) the operation is applied to.

li.p: for ME: all, auxiliary, cdr, comsvc, db, diameterapp, iohd, ioho, oame
for SM: all, auxiliary, db, ioho, oame, smapp

row.entry: Changes the group ID to GID.
Allows to use a duplicate (non-unique) GID.
Changes the password to this (encrypted) PASSWORD.

fig.codeblock: [root@sps-me-oame-0 ~]# /opt/tpa/sbin/modify-group -T all -n newGroup1 group1 <2018.12.04 16:12:40 -0500><sps-me-oame-0><modify-group> INFO: Checking if the current operation is allowed. <2018.12.04 16:12:40 -0500><sps-me-oame-0><modify-group> INFO: Taking the operation '/usr/sbin/usermod -s "/bin/sh" newuser1' on 'all'. <2018.12.04 16:12:41 -0500><sps-me-oame-0><modify-group> INFO: The operation succeeded on all target nodes. <2018.12.04 16:12:41 -0500><sps-me-oame-0><modify-group> INFO: Done with success.
